channel.title: How was RSC made?
channel.description: I downloaded Adventure Games Studio 3.1.2 SPI and it's sprites and characters are 2D just like RSC and I also noticed that on the sample game they provide you, it has 3D areas! Coincidence? Because on AGStudios it also has a scripting place where you can right up your own code and stuff so it seems like RSC was made using that, or am I wrong? I was just wondering

item.title: How was RSC made?
item.dc:creator: @dimmu_borgir dimmu borgir
item.description:
@dimmu_borgir wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:11, topic:291909”][quote author=`Lewk_ link=topic=385725.msg2895428#msg2895428 date=1249179960]
I honestly think RSC looks like it was drawn by an 11 year old.
[/quote]

Drawn by 11 year olds and still kicks rs2 ass :)[/quote]

LOL OWNED

Read full topic

item.title: How was RSC made?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:6, topic:291909”]Rsc was based off devious mud. DeviousMud was based off some bullshit games andrew and his brothers made.
back in 1996ish. (1 year before this). Gower has been working with Java since Java was released.

It was made from scratch.[/quote]

Wow. That’s pretty impressive. I heard it started as a school project, too.

Read full topic

item.title: How was RSC made?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventure_Game_Studio

It seems that it was being developed around the same time as RSC.

AGS can create games with a graphical range from 256 colours and a resolution of 320x200 (games with more "classic" looks) to true colour games with a resolution of up to 1024x768 (games with more "modern" looks) and an alpha channel. The higher the resolution, the more demanding a game is on computer resources, resulting in the need for a faster computer.

I believe RSC also uses 16 bit colors, but I’m probably wrong. I don’t know much about RSC. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
